It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its delicate, daisy-like flowers that bloom in the summer months. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in cooler, moist environments. Due to its limited habitat and specific environmental requirements, Carenophila montana is considered a vulnerable species.
